etymology.description: 白(白) (bái, "white") + 王(王) (wáng, "king") = resplendent king -> imperial
etymology.interpretation: The character 皇(皇) (huáng) combines 白(白) (bái, "white") for brightness or purity with 王(王) (wáng, "king"), emphasizing the resplendent and authoritative nature associated with imperial or royal status.

examples.chinese: 这是皇家的风格(這是皇家的風格)。
皇室成员享受特殊待遇(皇室成員享受特殊待遇)，国家尊崇他们(國家尊崇他們)。
examples.pinyin: Huángshì chéngyuán xiǎngshòu tèshū dàiyù, guójiā zūnchóng tāmén.
examples.english: Royal family members enjoy special privileges; the nation respects them.
